CatDescriptText: George Baker, steelworker, Duquesne, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "No, I don't. From a health standpoint, I do not approve of smoking.  And I don't smoke myself."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Baker wearing dark hat with feather, light colored cardigan sweater, and opened dark cross hatch patterned zippered jacket, standing with hands in pockets in front of bakery
